answers.author: Tom Nosack
answers.text:
Ours is set  up as an enterprise activity. Here is a link to their business plan: 
http://www.cityofvancouver.us/upload/contents/1067/2008ParkingServicesBP.pdf
It is currently within our development review/permitting organization.

answers.author: James Stegmaier
answers.text:
I know Oak Park, IL, has an entire Parking division within Public Works that manages the system.
http://www.oak-park.us/Parking/index.html


I know Oak Park, IL, has an entire Parking division within Public Works that manages the system.

http://www.oak-park.us/Parking/index.html

answers.author: Jackson Tuttle
answers.text:
Jay  -  Williamsburg is too small for a parking division, so we give the Police most of it - including managing our public parking garage; and handling parking enforcement, of course.  Public Works, however, takes the lead on posting/change on-street regulations as a traffic management function.  Finance sells residential parking permits near the College, and takes citation payment.   CM, Police Chief and Public Works Director get personally involved with parking policy and public relations issues...it's a continuous issue in our little town.

Public Works, however, takes the lead on posting/change on-street regulations as a traffic management function. answers.author: Tom Nosack
answers.text:
Having said where ours currently resides, we are also evaluating changing it to a contract activity. We have a few parking structures, a mature street and surface lot system and the ROI is looking very close for enforcement and structure/lot management. We don't think parking management necessarily needs to be done by city employees...

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is researching “parking” in their organization chart.  That is, currently in their model:
Parking citations is in the PD
Residential parking is in Transportation
Parking garages is handled by an analyst 
Parking meters are in Traffic Maintenance
Please share your parking models showing where the different areas of responsible fall.  Your time and expertise is appreciated!
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Where Does "Parking" Fit in Your Org Chart?
